title: eCupid
description: This week, Chris Haigy, Drew McFadden and Eric Henke watched the 2011 romantic (?) comedy (?) eCupid, featuring a bunch of straight people trying to play gay, and Morgan Fairchild as a magical computer genie.
topics: Why gay movies can't seem to get kissing right
Bad boys, boy next door types, skaterboys and dirty, dirty fratboys

title: Going Down in La La Land
description: This week, the boys watched the 2011 film Going Down in La La Land, the almost certainly semi-autobiographical story of a reluctant pornstar who finds the love of America's favorite sitcom dad. Or, as it's described by Google "Friendships sustain people living in Hollywood and help them deal with the celebrity-obsessed culture."
topics: The films of Jet Set Men
Whether Chris got paid enough for posing nude

title: Eating Out
description: This week, we talked about the 2004 "sex comedy" Eating Out, which at the time was hailed as gay sexy fun. 2004 was a different time. A time of Blockbuster Video, flip phones, and questionable consent. A time when it was totally cool for men to get laid through trickery. A time when supposed allies were allowed to just make it rain gay slurs. Basically, I'm saying this movie hasn't aged well.
topics: What it meant to be early 2000's attractive
Which Doctor Who was the gayest

title: Vampire Boys
description: This week, Chris asked if we could watch the 2011 horror romance Vampire Boys, and like idiots we all said "I don't know what that is, but sure." With vampires who can go out in the sunlight, and aren't afraid of crosses, but do need the love of a mortal, it's a lot like a gay Twilight. A Twinklight, if you will.
topics: The porn that Chris pretends he doesn't watch

title: Kiss Me Kill Me
description: Hey all you cool cats and kittens, this week, we discussed the 2015 tiger-centric film Kiss Me Kill Me, a neo-noir Hollywood thrilller directed by two-time We Read Movies director Casper Andreas. When Dusty Young's rich fiance is murdered in what looks, to everyone but the characters in the movie, like a robbery gone wrong, he is blamed for the murder. Now, with the help of some sassy lesbians and a hypnotist drag queen, he'll have to find the real killer, clear his name and maybe find love along the way.
topics: How soon after your fiance is murdered is TOO soon to start a new relationship
Chris takes a break from describing the plot of this movie to describe the plot of a porno

title: Kaboom
description: This week, we talked about Greg Araki's 2010 psycho-sci-fi-sex-dramedy Kaboom. Look, I don't know how to describe this movie to you, it's crazy. Someone sees a murder, there's a lesbian witch and a doomsday cult and some very gross mac and cheese.
topics: What kind of dickpics we'd like to receive in our inbox (wereadmovies@gmail.com)
How big a cock you'd need to gag three people with it at the same time
The proper way to eat pussy like it's spaghetti
